ZDA začele uradni odstop od pariškega podnebnega sporazuma
05 Nov 2019, 08:50 by STA

Ameriška vlada je v ponedeljek začela uradno uresničevanje odstopa od pariškega podnebnega sporazuma. Predsednik ZDA Donald Trump ga je napovedal že leta 2017, vendar je z uradnimi koraki moral počakati, ker glede na določila umik ni možen pred iztekom treh let od uveljavitve sporazuma, ki je bil sprejet na pobudo ZDA.



Predsednik ZDA Donald Trump ga je napovedal že leta 2017, vendar je z uradnimi koraki moral počakati. Foto: Sta

WASHINGTON > Pariški podnebni sporazum je stopil v veljavo 4. novembra 2016, umik pa traja leto dni, kar pomeni, da ga ZDA uradno ne morejo zapustiti pred 4. novembrom 2020. Če bo Trump volitve prihodnje leto izgubil, bodo ZDA znova pristopile k sporazumu, saj to obljublja vsak demokratski predsedniški kandidat, ki ima kaj možnosti za zmago.
Trump trdi, da je sporazum krivičen do ZDA, čeprav gre za sporazum prostovoljnih zavez držav za zmanjšanje izpustov toplogrednih plinov. Trump je sicer že leta 2016 govoril o odstopu od sporazuma, ker naj bi šlo za potegavščino v korist Kitajske.
Državni sekretar ZDA Mike Pompeo, ki je v ponedeljek obvestil Združene narode, da odstopajo od podnebnega sporazuma, je minuli mesec zatrdil, da sporazum polaga "nepravično ekonomsko breme" na ZDA. Zatrdil je tudi, da država zmanjšuje izpuste vseh vrst in da so se med letoma 2005 in 2017 izpusti toplogrednih plinov zmanjšali za 13 odstotkov. Gospodarska rast je po Pompeovih zagotovilih v tem času cvetela.
ZDA bodo novembra prihodnje leto postale edina država na svetu, ki ne bo članica pariškega podnebnega sporazuma. Demokrati upajo, da bo tako le do januarja 2021, ko bo prisegel novi predsednik ZDA.

US to formally withdraw from Paris Climate Agreement
05 Nov 2019, 08:50 by STA

On Monday, the US government officially launched a derogation from the Paris Climate Agreement. US President Donald Trump announced it in 2017, but he has had to wait for official steps because, according to the provisions, it is not possible to withdraw before the expiration of three years from the entry into force of the agreement adopted at the initiative of the United States.



US President Donald Trump announced it in 2017, but with official steps he had to wait. Photo: Sta

WASHINGTON> The Paris Climate Agreement enters into force on November 4, 2016, with a year's withdrawal, meaning that the United States cannot formally leave it before November 4, 2020. If Trump loses the election next year, the U.S. will re-accede to the agreement , as every Democratic presidential candidate who has any chance of winning promises.
Trump claims that the agreement is unfair to the US, even though it is an agreement of voluntary commitments by states to reduce greenhouse gas emissions. Trump had already spoken in 2016 of withdrawing from the agreement because it was a prank in favor of China.
US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo, who informed the United Nations on Monday that he is withdrawing from the climate agreement, said last month that the agreement places "an unfair economic burden" on the United States. He also asserted that the state is reducing emissions of all kinds and that greenhouse gas emissions have fallen by 13 percent between 2005 and 2017. According to Pompeo's assurances, economic growth flourished during this time.
The US will become the only country in the world not to be a member of the Paris Climate Agreement next November. Democrats hope it will be until January 2021, when the new US president is sworn in.
